text: yeah next week you're gonna have your
first analyst meeting you've been here
just a little bit over a year what is it
you want to tell Wall Street because as
a stock point of view this has been a
terrible year we need to tell the
straight HP story we need to explain
business unit by business unit what our
strategy is where the growth is going to
come from what the products or services
or solutions are that we're going to bet
on and how we're going to drive those
consistently over the next four to five
years then we need to explain why HP is
better together and tell our story with
clarity and transparency so that
investors both buy-side and sell-side
understand what it is we're doing and
then they can make a decision about
whether they want to invest in HP this
stock is at levels of about nineteen
ninety seven and you've lost thirty
percent in your year what happened I'd
say cause number one was inconsistency
of leadership because they bring in each
CEO brings in their own team exactly I'd
have a slightly different strategy so we
need consistency of leadership and
consistency of investment in the
products and solutions that we know will
sell what's the strategy well for each
individual business unit there is a very
coherent customer focused strategy and
product focused strategy so I'll give
you one example for you know so our
printing business listen we are betting
on ink but we are taking the traditional
ink model and we are pioneering now a
model called ink advantage you pay a
little bit more for the printer but your
ink cartridges that you buy as you need
them or much lower cost then in the
United States we are introducing a
subscription model right which is it
should be much lower cost per page so
that a profitable agent and more
profitable so that's the kind of thing
we've got it and we got to differentiate
our ink and we've got to differentiate
our toner from the more commodity
oriented competitors some people feel
like you walked away from consumer PC we
have not walked away from consumer PC
you know certainly we have not been as
successful in that business over the
last year or two as we would like to be
but you've seen the revamp of our PC
line thin and light too
convertibles one enterprise tablet and
we're going to stick with that and you
know the other thing people always say
we're printing in a PC of printing in a
PC company you know the two big growth
areas of this company are of course our
enterprise server storage and networking
as well as our software business and our
services business listen it's a big
business I think that can be an
important part of our portfolio and we
got to turn around on our hands
